html:
Currently we list World of Warcraft, (even though it should be named Battle.net since this ToS covers Diablo and Starcraft), as the consumer not having the right to leave the service. This is not true.

Here is the Current Terms of Service.

Here is an excerpt from this ToS.

ACCOUNT SUSPENSION/CANCELATION.

BLIZZARD MAY SUSPEND, TERMINATE, MODIFY, OR DELETE ACCOUNTS AT ANY TIME FOR ANY REASON OR FOR NO REASON, WITH OR WITHOUT NOTICE TO YOU. Accounts terminated by Blizzard for any type of abuse, including without limitation a violation of these TOU, a Game-specific Terms of Use, or a Game EULA will not be reactivated for any reason. For purposes of explanation and not limitation, most account suspensions, terminations and/or deletions are the result of violations of these TOU, a Game-specific Terms of Use, a Game EULA or other Blizzard policy. You may cancel the Account registered to you at any time by requesting that your personal information be removed from the Account, as specified in Blizzard’s Privacy Policy. Blizzard may stop offering and/or supporting the Service at any time.

This clearly contradicts what we currently have listed.

Also we should mention the fact that Blizzard can terminate your account at any time.

--
www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/Unhosted/ToS-DR
---

subject: World of Warcraft/Battle.net ToS Errors
text:
Currently we list World of Warcraft, (even though it should be named 
Battle.net since this ToS covers Diablo and Starcraft), as the consumer not 
having the right to leave the service. This is not true.

Here is the Current Terms of Service<http://No%20Right%20to%20leave%20the%20service>
.

Here is an excerpt from this ToS.

*ACCOUNT SUSPENSION/CANCELATION.* BLIZZARD MAY SUSPEND, TERMINATE, MODIFY, 
> OR DELETE ACCOUNTS AT ANY TIME FOR ANY REASON OR FOR NO REASON, WITH OR 
> WITHOUT NOTICE TO YOU. Accounts terminated by Blizzard for any type of 
> abuse, including without limitation a violation of these TOU, a 
> Game-specific Terms of Use, or a Game EULA will not be reactivated for any 
> reason. For purposes of explanation and not limitation, most account 
> suspensions, terminations and/or deletions are the result of violations of 
> these TOU, a Game-specific Terms of Use, a Game EULA or other Blizzard 
> policy. *You may cancel the Account registered to you at any time by 
> requesting that your personal information be removed from the Account, as 
> specified in Blizzard’s Privacy Policy<http://us.blizzard.com/company/about/privacy.html>
> .* Blizzard may stop offering and/or supporting the Service at any time.


This clearly contradicts what we currently have listed. 

Also we should mention the fact that Blizzard can terminate your account at 
any time.

--
